concept.title: Character Encoding and Conversion Framework Overview

conbody.p: The Charconv Framework component provides APIs and built-in converters to convert text between Unicode and other character encodings.
The Component also provides APIs which list the encodings available on the device and which select a specific encoding to convert to or from.

section.title: Architecture
section.p: The Charconv Framework is part of the Character Conversion (Charconv) Framework collection.

section.title: APIs
section.p: The Charconv Framework includes the following APIs:

entry.p: Converts text between Unicode and another character set. Conversion can be performed on fragments of input, including handling the case when the input text is truncated midway through a multi-byte character. This allows clients to do conversion in small steps, which may be preferred for large amounts of text or when text is arriving in fragments from an external source.

Converts text between Unicode (UTF-16) and the two Unicode transformation formats UTF-7 and UTF-8. These are ASCII-compatible encodings of Unicode which use sequences of multiple bytes to encode non-ASCII characters. Conversion can be performed in incremental steps.
Gets the names of all available converters.
Provides static character conversion utilities for complex encodings.
Defines the methods in the CharConv Character Set Conversion plug-in interface.

section.title: Built-in converters
section.p: The built-in converters are used by most languages. Each converter is identified by a Unique Identifier (UID). The UIDs are defined in the charconv.h header file.

section.title: Typical uses
section.p: The Charconv Framework can be used to:

li.p: Convert between a foreign encoding and Unicode.
Convert between a Unicode transformation format and Unicode.
Write additional plug-in converters for specific encodings or languages.
Get a list of converter names.
Automatically detect the character encoding to be converted.
Get the character converter UID using its Internet standard encoding name.
